intro: Manettia coccinea var. spraguei, commonly known as the red-stemmed manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its vibrant red stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. Its flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually pink to red in color, adding ornamental value to gardens and natural habitats.
